title: Man smashes his truck through gas station store then rips off his license plate before walking out
text:
This is the moment a man who had been drinking crashed his pickup truck through the doors of a Michigan gas station after losing control of the vehicle.

Surveillance footage captured William Edmonds, 24, smashing his car at speed into the center of the shop.

Moments before leaving the scene of the crash, Edmonds was seen pulling off the license plate from his truck and then calmly walking away.

William Edmonds, 24, drove his truck into a BP gas station in Michigan

The truck plowed through the front doors of the gas station late on Thursday night

Edmonds, 24, was charged with reckless driving and leaving the scene of a crash

Incredibly, nobody was hurt in the accident which happened on Thursday at a BP station in Ortonville, about 50 miles northwest of Detroit, although broken bottles of liquor led to a small fire.

The Oakland County Prosecutor's Office charged Edmonds with reckless driving and failing to report an accident.

The sheriff's office say Edmonds seemed to suddenly accelerate in the gas station's parking lot around 2:30am before hitting a gas pump and careening straight into the store.

Edmonds, who is a regular at the gas station explained to police that he had been drinking prior to the crash.

An employee told police that Edmonds bought a beer, opened it and then got into his truck in the moments before the crash.

Edmonds could be seen on video pulling the license plate from his truck before fleeing

The accident caused a huge amount of damage inside the business and even set a small fire

He said he wanted to 'speed around the gas pumps because his new tires spin easily', according an incident report as seen by NBC News but had 'no intention of crashing into the station or hurting anyone'.

He told police he was attempting to spin around 180 degrees.

Before calmly walking out of the store, amid the carnage Edmonds ripped off his license plate because 'he felt scared'.

Edmonds was arraigned and released on a $5,000 but has been instructed to never return to the gas station.

He must also undergo drug and alcohol tests twice a week.
